LGBTQIA Resource Center Celebrates Pride Month
The LGBTQIA Resource Center has created a variety of events for Pride Month at Georgia Tech, including employee engagement opportunities.
Facebook
Twitter
Email
The LGBTQIA Resource Center invites the campus community to participate in a celebration of the LGBTQIA community.
Oct 12, 2020
— Atlanta, GA
The LGBTQIA Resource Center invites the campus community to participate in a celebration of the LGBTQIA community. Partnering with Grad Pride, Pride Alliance, and the Student Government Association, the Center has created a variety of events for Pride Month at Georgia Tech, including employee engagement opportunities.
Click each link for more information.
LGBTQIA History @ Tech Archive Project
Thursday, Oct. 15, 6 – 7 p.m., Bluejeans:
https://bluejeans.com/397655755
Body Positivity in Queer and Trans Community
Friday, Oct. 16, noon – 1 p.m.
LGBTQIA Faculty/Staff Social
Wednesday, Oct. 21, 5 – 6 p.m.
Level Up: Queer People of Color
Thursday, Oct. 22, 9 – 10:30 a.m.
Coffee Hour: Asexual and Aromantic Students
Tuesday, Oct. 27, 11 a.m. – noon
Netflix Party and Popcorn With the Women's Resource Center
Wednesday, Oct. 28, 6 – 8 p.m.
Instagram Live Crafting With the Women's Resource Center
Thursday, Oct. 29, 11 a.m. – noon
Netflix Movie
Friday, Oct. 30, 11 a.m. – 1 p.m.
Ace Space Game Night
Friday, Oct. 30, 6:30 – 8 p.m.
Employee Engagement Opportunities:
Virtual Games: Scattergories, Wednesday, Oct. 21, 5 – 6 p.m.
Data Collection and Reporting Workshop. Learn better practices for navigating sex, gender, and sexual orientation in data, forms, and surveys. (Workshop is also open to students.) Friday, Nov. 6, noon – 1 p.m.
Virtual Game: LGBTQIA Trivia, Tuesday, Nov. 10, 5 – 6 p.m.
To register for these events, click
here .
